titleInfo.title: Letter No. 4 to William Hornby, President and Governor, Council at Bombay, from Edward Galley at Bushire

mods.abstract: Letter reports that Meer Cahn has not handed over the papers of the suspected French messenger and allowed him to depart for Muscat. Records numerous departures and arrivals (including the Revenge, commanded by Captain Donald Campbell of the Madras Establishment, and the Begler,commanded by Captain Peter Scott). The letter also provides a brief summary of the political situation in Persia and discusses a number of administrative and financial issues (including sales of wool and monthly accounts).
